How to quit vim?: What’s the base case when recursively reversing a linked list?
q:
if (head === null || head.next === null) return head;

This stops the recursion at the last node (which becomes the new head).

It rewires the .next pointer of the current node to the result of the recursive merge/reverse.
You’re linking the current node to the rest of the solved list.

How to quit vim?: How do you detect a cycle in a linked list in O(1) space?
q:
Use two pointers:
	•	slow = slow.next
	•	fast = fast.next.next
If fast === slow → cycle
If fast === null || fast.next === null → no cycle
